snippet: Police installations, public buses and even the homes of prison officials have been targeted in Santa Catarina State, which has traditionally ranked among the country’s safest regions.
abstract: Wave of arson attacks is spreading across state in southern Brazil, largely targeting police installations, public buses and even homes of prison officials in region traditionally ranked among country’s safest; officials describe attacks as violent reaction to reports of inmate abuse in Santa Catarina’s prisons.
lead_paragraph: Police installations, public buses and even the homes of prison officials have been targeted in Santa Catarina State, which has traditionally ranked among the country’s safest regions.

headline.seo: Wave of Arson Attacks in Brazil Is Tied to Reports of Inmate Abuse
